required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study on the Burden of Influenza-related Hospitalizations and Emergency Room (ER) Visits in Children in Spain
clinical_study.official_title: Burden of Influenza-related Hospitalizations and Emergency Room Visits in Children in Spain

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to quantify the inpatient and ER visits burden of laboratory-confirmed influenza, and compare the clinical features, severity, complications, risk factors and socioeconomic impact of influenza in children presenting with acute respiratory illness (ARI) and/or isolated fever, with or without laboratory-confirmed influenza.

detailed_description.textblock:
The total medical cost associated with each hospitalization or ER visit will also be calculated at the end of this study.
The study will be conducted from October, 2010, until May, 2011. Each subject will be followed-up for 21-30 days via telephone. The follow-up medical chart review will preferably be performed within 7 days after the telephone contact.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Laboratory-confirmed Influenza Presenting With an Acute Respiratory Illness (ARI) and/or Isolated Fever
primary_outcome.description: ARI was defined as one or more of the following symptoms: sore throat (in children greater than or equal to (≥) 3 years old), coryza (runny nose), cough, breathing difficulties. Isolated fever was defined as: oral temperature ≥37.5°C / axillary temperature ≥37.5°C / Rectal temperature ≥38°C / tympanic temperature on oral setting ≥37.5°C / tympanic temperature on rectal setting ≥38°C without an obvious cause.

primary_outcome.measure: Direct Medical Cost Per Hospitalization or ER Visit With Laboratory-confirmed Influenza
primary_outcome.description: Ward specific room charge and Intensive Care Unit (ICU) were computed as daily charge multiplied by the number of days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Other Laboratory-confirmed Respiratory Viruses
secondary_outcome.description: Among the other laboratory-confirmed respiratory viruses there were:adenovirus, respiratory syncytial virus, parainfluenza virus 1, 2 and 3, metapneumovirus, bocavirus, rhinovirus or coronavirus. The outcome was assessed in subjects with an acute respiratory illness (ARI) and/or isolated fever episode.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Fatal Outcomes
secondary_outcome.description: Deaths from ARI and/or fever episodes by laboratory-confirmed influenza status were assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Secondary Bacterial Infections
secondary_outcome.description: The outcome assessed the various complications by laboratory-confirmed influenza status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Potential Risk Factors at Study Start by Laboratory-confirmed Influenza Status
secondary_outcome.description: Risk factors were classified as pre-existing conditions, breast-feeding status and day-care status.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 till Day 28-37 (between October 2010 until May 2011)
secondary_outcome.description: The outcomes was assessed in subjects with laboratory-confirmed influenza status

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Using Any ARI and/or Fever Related Medication Taken Prior to Hospitalization or ER Visit by Laboratory-confirmed Influenza Status
secondary_outcome.description: ARI and/or fever related medication included: antivirals, antibiotics, cough suppressants, pain medication, antipyretics and mucolytics.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Using Any ARI and/or Fever Related Medication Prescribed During Hospitalization or ER Visit by Laboratory-confirmed Influenza Status
secondary_outcome.description: ARI and/or fever related medication included: antivirals, antibiotics, cough suppressants, pain medication, antipyretics and mucolytics.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Using Any ARI and/or Fever Related Medication Prescribed Since Hospitalization or ER Visit by Laboratory-confirmed Influenza Status
secondary_outcome.description: ARI and/or fever related medication included: antivirals, antibiotics, cough suppressants, pain medication, antipyretics and mucolytics.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Using Any Non-prescribed ARI and/or Fever Related Medication Taken Since Hospitalization or ER Visit
secondary_outcome.description: ARI and/or fever related medication included: antivirals, antibiotics, cough suppressants, pain medication, antipyretics and mucolytics.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Days of School Absenteeism
secondary_outcome.description: School absenteeism was assessed among patients during the follow-up period by laboratory-confirmed influenza status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Days of Parent or Caregiver Time Off Work
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome assessed absenteeism among caregivers to provide patient care during the follow-up period by laboratory-confirmed influenza status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Household Members With Influenza-like Illness
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome assessed the number of cases with household contacts presenting influenza like illness symptoms during the follow-up period by laboratory-confirmed influenza status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Household Members Presenting Influenza Like Illness Symptoms (ARI and/or Isolated Fever)
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome assessed the proportion of influenza like illness (ILI) among household members of children < 15 years with and without laboratory-confirmed influenza.

arm_group.description: Children <15 years of age hospitalized for or presenting to an ER for acute ARI and/or isolated fever during the influenza season.

intervention.description: Samples will be tested to quantify the inpatient and ER visits burden of laboratory-confirmed influenza.
Log Sheet will be used to collected data on a monthly basis for the following age groups: < 6 months; 6-23 months; 24-59 months; > 5 years.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects for whom the investigator believes that they and/or their parents/guardians can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol.
- A male or female <15 years of age at the time of study entry. A subject will become ineligible on his/her 15th birthday.
- Signed informed consent from the parents or guardians of the subject and signed assent from children ≥ 12 years old.
- Presenting with a sudden onset clinical process comprising :
- Isolated fever defined as: oral temperature ≥ 37.5°C / axillary temperature ≥ 37.5°C / Rectal temperature ≥ 38°C / tympanic temperature on oral setting ≥ 37.5°C / tympanic temperature on rectal setting ≥ 38°C without an obvious cause.
And/or
- ARI defined as one or more of the following symptoms: sore throat, coryza, cough, breathing difficulties.
Exclusion Criteria:
• Children in foster care.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment started in October, 2010, and last until May, 2011, or until the target sample size was enrolled.

group.title: Influenza Group
group.description: Children <15 years of age hospitalized for or presenting to an Emergency Room (ER) for Acute Respiratory Illness (ARI) and/or isolated fever during the influenza season.

group.title: Influenza Group
group.description: Children less than (<) 15 years of age hospitalized for or presenting to an ER for acute ARI and/or isolated fever during the influenza season.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Laboratory-confirmed Influenza Presenting With an Acute Respiratory Illness (ARI) and/or Isolated Fever
outcome.description: ARI was defined as one or more of the following symptoms: sore throat (in children greater than or equal to (≥) 3 years old), coryza (runny nose), cough, breathing difficulties. Isolated fever was defined as: oral temperature ≥37.5°C / axillary temperature ≥37.5°C / Rectal temperature ≥38°C / tympanic temperature on oral setting ≥37.5°C / tympanic temperature on rectal setting ≥38°C without an obvious cause.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the according-to-protocol (ATP) cohort for analysis, which included all evaluable subjects (i.e. those meeting all eligibility criteria and complying with the procedures defined in the protocol) for whom data concerning endpoint measures were available.

group.title: Influenza Group

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Laboratory-confirmed Influenza Presenting With an Acute Respiratory Illness (ARI) and/or Isolated Fever

outcome.title: Direct Medical Cost Per Hospitalization or ER Visit With Laboratory-confirmed Influenza
outcome.description: Ward specific room charge and Intensive Care Unit (ICU) were computed as daily charge multiplied by the number of days.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the according-to-protocol (ATP) cohort for analysis, which included all evaluable subjects (i.e. those meeting all eligibility criteria and complying with the procedures defined in the protocol) for whom data concerning endpoint measures were available and who were hospitalized or visited an emergency room.

reported_events.time_frame: No solicited or unsolicited adverse events were collected during this study. No SAEs or fatal events were recorded during this study.
reported_events.desc: Serious and non-serious adverse events were not planned to be assessed as part of this study protocol.

group.title: Influenza Group
group.description: Children <15 years of age hospitalized for or presenting to an ER for acute ARI and/or isolated fever during the influenza season.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
